page.title: 10Industry
page.content: Harden Quarry at Biddlestone produces a hard red volcanic stone (Andesite?). It is known to have been used at Buckingham Palace on the drive.Some of the stone is exported mainy to Holland. Here it is used for the cycle tracks to make them a different colour from the main roadways. The stone is exported out of Berwick Harbour and many wagons are used at these times.Wagons come from all over the United Kingdom including Northern Island. None of the employees are from this area.Most live in Rothbury.It is owned at present by Tilcon which is based in Yorkshire.The Quarry is expanding at present.
